newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Korean decision on Fokker seen delayed.
newsitem.headline: Korean decision on Fokker seen delayed.

text.p: Administrators of the bankrupt Dutch planemaker Fokker NV said on Friday that they did not expect a decision on the future of Fokker from the South Korean government before the end of November.
South Korea's Samsung Aerospace Industries has been given exclusive access to Fokker's accounts with a view to a possible takeover of its core planemaking business.

Samsung on Wednesday said involvement of the South Korean government was not at issue, saying: "The only government approval Samsung needs is from the central bank of Korea on capital investment abroad."
